titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the C. C. Gately Company Records AIA.039
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Rachel Searcy

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-12-10T13:04-0500

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

did.abstract: This collection consists of materials documenting the functions and activities of the C.C. Gately Company, a Brooklyn contracting firm operated by Joseph T. Gately in the late 19th century. Materials include ledgers, cash books, and other financial records, including receipts and cancelled checks.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Donated by Dermot Gately in March of 2000. The accession number associated with this gift is 1997.030.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Dermot Gately, the creator of this collection, were transferred to New York University in 2000. Some materials in this collection are in the public domain and the remainder of the collection is expected to enter the public domain in 2025. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection currently under copyright must be secured from the Tamiment Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; C.C. Gately Company Records; AIA 039; box number; folder number; Archives of Irish America, Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The C.C. Gately Company (1856-1905) was a contracting firm operated by Joseph T. Gately in Brooklyn, New York.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The order in which these materials were sent to the Tamiment Library has been maintained.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of materials documenting the functions and activities of the C.C. Gately Company, a Brooklyn contracting firm operating in the late 19th century. Materials include ledgers, cash books, and other financial records, including receipts and cancelled checks.
